alternatives.transcript: presenting with the chief complaint of shortness of breath and fatigue he was alert awake and oriented but obviously fatigued he stated that these symptoms have become progressively worse over the last six months mister palmer states that all activity exacerbates his shortness of breath and fatigue and he does confirm that he's still having symptoms at rest rest he states that lying flat worsens his condition nothing improves it and that he has been sleeping in his chair at night his respiratory rate was high at twenty two his blood pressure was low at eighty over fifty and his oxygen saturation was low at eighty six percent the patient has a past medical history of hypertension hyperlipidemia diabetes and atrial fibrillation for which he takes lisinopril ten milligrams once a day warfarin two point five milligrams twice a day clopidogrel seventy five milligrams once a day metformin five hundred milligrams twice a day atorvastatin ten milligrams once a day furosemide twenty milligrams twice a day and metoprolol succinate fifty milligrams once a day and the patient also reported a triple bypass previously and that he's had five stents with the last being in june twenty twenty two for a left anterior descending occlusion the patient said that at that time his physician told him he was not going to be a candidate for any more procedures and he's had no other hospitalizations besides for those cardiac procedures he has a maternal family history of terminal breast cancer and a paternal family history of alzheimer's the patient did endorse fatigue and eight pound weight gain over two weeks wheezing dyspypnea orthopnea and edema of the lower extremities today his physical exam showed jvd without carotid bruit tachycardia with a split s two laterally displaced pmi by basilar rails and wheezing on auscultation of his lungs he had a plus one pitting edema with intact distal pulses and non tender calves in his lower extremities his labs showed a troponin of zero point zero four and a bnp of four thousand both of which are high his chest x-ray showed cardiomegaly and pulmonary edema his two d echo showed a dilated left ventricle with an ejection fraction of thirty percent and his ekg showed a left axis displacement with a left bundle branch block i diagnosed him today with ischemic dilated cardiomyopathy due to his previous cardiac history his physical exam and the labs i got back today as well as that imaging he is a new york heart association stage four and should be admitted to the icu his condition is serious he has no known drug allergies i'd like him to have vitals every two hours strict bed rest strict input output daily weights and deep vein thrombosis prophylaxis i'd like him on a low sodium diet i'd like him on an iv fluid protocol of fluid lock keep vein open i'm going to hold all meds except his clopidogrel seventy five milligrams once a day and his warfarin two point five milligrams twice a day i'm going to add a dobutamine iv drip and an insulin sliding scale the patient should be on bipap with an input of sixteen and an output of six i would like him to have serial troponins to monitor his troponin levels since it was high earlier and i'd like him to continue having ptinrs to monitor his clotting as we have him on both clopidogrel and warfarin i will be consulting interventional cardiology to discuss the possible placement of a crtd or an aicd and then after discharge the patient will be instructed to maintain a healthy diet wait and then avoid strenuous activity until he is released by his cardiologist overall i think his outlook looks pretty good and please go see him whenever you're ready thank you
